result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio M Wright was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.

Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" and continued programming.
Complete parenting class.

Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Antonio M Wright in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.
Court modified the no contact order to a NO VIOLENT CONTACT ORDER.  rmm

Defendant Antonio M Wright in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Antonio M Wright in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant not compliant and given condition days on 15CM257.  The remaining condition time on this is stayed.  Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Bail Refund Check Packet

Defendant Antonio M Wright in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Lisa G.

  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
*
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 08/21/2015.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" and continued programming.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-Complete parenting class.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Victim Impact Statement, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, and Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court modifed the no contact order to allow the defendant to pick up the children and drop them off at the residence.  No direct contact with the victim.

AS TO COUNT 2:   Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.
.
AS TO COUNT 1 AS AMENDED:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.

Defendant Antonio M Wright in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Bail Jumping, Domestic Abuse, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 946.49(1)(a), 973.055(1), a Class A Misdemeanor.

Defendant Antonio M Wright in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Status conference held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 4/08/15 in Branch 40.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.

Defendant Antonio M Wright in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Status Conference held.  Defendant has an older case with a trial date of 4/08/15.  Defense may want a new trial date as he has not been able to meet with his client.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Antonio M Wright in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Defendant Antonio M Wright in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant HAS A LOWER PENDING CASE AND is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Antonio M Wright not in court.  Ann R. Lpez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.
